clinical_study.brief_title: ArcadiusXP L Post Market Clinical Follow-Up
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Follow-up of the ArcadiusXP L Stand Alone Intervertebral Body Fusion Device

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect clinical and radiological mid-term (2 years) data on the ArcadiusXP L® lumbar stand-alone cage in a post-market clinical follow-up study (PMCF) limited to 32 patients.

primary_outcome.description: Difference between Oswestry Disability Index (ODI) at 2 years and preoperative ODI

secondary_outcome.measure: Fusion/arthrodesis status, and further radiological documentation of operated and adjacent levels
secondary_outcome.description: Angle difference in flexion and extension radiographs at each timepoint; analysis of AP and ML x-rays regarding changes in bone density (identification of bone bridges): CT/MRT are considered when available; consideration of pot. radiolucencies around the
Pain levels (back and leg) as measured via Visual Analogue scale (VAS) at each timepoint

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all indications as given by the instructions for use
- Patients with persisting lumbosacral and pseudo-radicular pain scheduled for monosegmental lumbar interbody fusion from L4 to S1
- Age 18 - 60
- at least 6 months of unsuccessful treatment including conservative measures
- Non-sequestrated and subligamentous prolapse
Exclusion Criteria:
- all contraindications, which are listed in the instructions for use.
- existing pregnancy, planned or occurring during study period
- patients with a higher degree of segmental degeneration in other than the segment to be operated
- body- mass-index (BMI) > 30
- Systemic or local infection
- Increased risk of osteoporosis according to assessment by the SCORE evaluation
- Bone metabolism disorders
- Chemotherapy or radiotherapy (ongoing or planned)
- Participation in another clinical trial
- Scheduled for spinal litigation
- Other serious conditions that hinder the participation in the study
- Nanogel® filling of the cage, prior to implantation was not done
